questions.concept_html: We know\[\begin{array}{l}\mathrm{AA}^{-1}=\mathrm{I} \\\Rightarrow\left|\mathrm{AA}^{-1}\right|=|\mathrm{I}| \\\Rightarrow|\mathrm{A}|\left|\mathrm{A}^{-1}\right|=1 \\\Rightarrow\left|\mathrm{A}^{-1}\right|=\frac{1}{|\mathrm{~A}|} \\\Rightarrow\left|\mathrm{A}^{-1}\right|=|\mathrm{A}|^{-1}\end{array}\]Properties of determinants:- For a \( n \times n \) matrix \( A, \operatorname{det}(k A)=k^{n} \operatorname{det}(A) \).
questions.ocrQuestion:
Let \( A \) be a \( 3 \times 3 \) matrix such that \( \operatorname{det}(A)=-2 \), then \( \operatorname{det}\left(-2 A^{-1}\right) \) is equal to
(a) 4
(b) -4
(c) 8
(d) -2
